items.name: Plausible
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. To get insights into our website traffic without compromising on our users' privacy
  2. To ensure user privacy and take a privacy-focused approach and anonymizes and aggregates data
  3. To make web analytics accessible for all
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: Plausible helps you make informed decisions about your content and marketing strategies.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Plausible

items.name: Parcel.io
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
• Create and manage email design system
  • Create and manage email components
  • Create and optimize email code
  • Test and big fix
  • One click push to ESP
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: Parcel helps you become better at writing clean email code.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Parcel.io.

items.name: UTM.io
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
• To keep UTMs consistent
  • To ensure a cleaner data-profile
  • Monitor link performance
  • Manage all links in one place
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: UTM.io helps you build, manage, and collaborate on UTMs without spreadsheets.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of UTM.io

items.name: Grammarly
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
• We use the Chrome extension and Mac apps to check our work everywhere
  • We add our Style Guide to the team plan for consistency
  • We use it to draft the newsletter, playbooks, and other reader content
  • We use it to edit all content
  • We use it to make sure we don't have "embrassing" typos like this one
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: Grammarly helps you improve your writing and look more professional.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Grammarly

items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
• Automate the invitation process of 100,000 legacy contacts to Hey Rebekah
  • Reach out to target Partner Program companies with integration to Close.com CRM
  • Maintain cleaner legacy lists
  • Integrate cold and luke warm contact outreach to our Close.com CRM when engaged
items.short-description: Cold emails to warm up pipelines
items.name: Woodpecker
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: Woodpecker helps you fill-up the top of your funnel with consistent leads.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Woodpecker

items.name: SurgeGraph
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
• Keyword research for our website
  • Content planning and optimization
  • Keyword mapping
  • Picking off low hanging longtails
  • Support our organic growth
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: LSIGraph is an SEO tool that focuses on three crucial aspects of search engine optimization: selecting the proper keywords, producing optimized content, and creating pages linked contextually. The tool operates semantically and contextually.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of SurgeGraph

items.name: Guru
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. Centralized repository of knowledge
  2. Documenting everything at BRIL.LA
  3. Easily accessible from within the tools we use
  4. Sharing company information outside the org
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: Guru is a company-wide knowledge management tool that seamlessly integrates into your daily workflow, ensuring that the information essential to your job is easily accessible to you at all times.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo for Guru App.

items.name: Height
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
• Manage all our work effort in lists
  • Keep track of progress towards goals
  • Store/share information that we need to work on or to inform our work
  • Manage our to-do-lists and collaborate on them easier

‍
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: Height helps us manage projects across teams quicker and easier.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Height App

items.name: Webflow
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A platform for building and designing professional websites without writing code, empowering designers to create and customize visually stunning and functional websites with ease.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Webflow
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. We use Webflow as our primary website(s)
  2. It's a low-code design friendly platform to deploy performant websites in HTML/CSS

items.name: Whimsical
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A platform for creating and collaborating on diagrams and flowcharts, helping teams to communicate, plan, and design more effectively and efficiently.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Whimsical
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. We use Whimsical to create diagrams and illustrations for our work
  2. It helps create visual messaging to support verbose text

items.name: Wavebox
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A productivity platform that helps users to manage and organize their online tools and services, enabling them to work more efficiently and effectively in the digital world.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Wavebox
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2: 1. It helps us administer 40 tabs for 7 different email accounts in Chrome

items.name: Testimonials.to
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A testimonials management and gathering tool that helps businesses to collect and display customer feedback, leveraging the power of social proof to drive growth and build trust.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Testimonials.to
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. We're using it to gather video and text testimonials from former clients, friends, Rebekah's mom, and readers
  2. We use it to publish gathered testimonials directly to the website

items.name: Wireguard
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: An open-source virtual private network (VPN) protocol that offers fast, secure, and easy-to-use solutions for protecting online communication and data.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Wireguard
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. We use the Wireguard connection to establish a secure link to our VPC with a dedicated IP
  2. We use it to improve the security of our business data transfer/processing between remote-locations and our VPC

items.name: Squarespace
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A website building and hosting platform that enables individuals and businesses to easily create and manage professional and visually appealing websites with no coding required.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Squarespace
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. We used Squarespace to test their website development tool 7 years ago for BRIL.LA
  2. We published the site in a few hours, then forgot to change it ever since
  3. Hey, if it ain't broken....

items.name: Twilio Segment
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A platform for collecting, analyzing, and activating customer data, enabling businesses to improve their marketing and customer experiences and dri
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Twilio Segment
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. We use Twilio Segment to consolidate all our data from 5 sources to +30 destinations so everything's synced up
  2. It provides us with a holistic view of all the touch points a reader has with the company
  3. It gives us a birds-eye-view of the entire customer journey for a brand partner/sponsorship across all systems
  4. It allows us to personalize the relevance and experience per reader/user based on contextual information we have

items.name: Slack
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A messaging and collaboration platform that helps teams to communicate and work together more efficiently, streamlining their workflow and boosting productivity.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Slack
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. We use Slack to communicate/collaborate amongst the team
  2. To keep discussions on point in channels/threads
  3. To share news and updates internally
  4. To collaborate with vendors/clients/partners via Slack Connect

items.name: Sprout Social
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A platform for managing and analyzing social media presence, helping businesses to connect with their customers and grow their brand on social media.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Sprout Social

items.name: Relume
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A a component library for Webflow, helping designers to create and customize professional and visually appealing websites with ease.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Relume
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. We built our whole Webflow site using components from Relume's library
  2. It's an opinionated set of components built upon Finsweet's Client-First framework
  3. Saves us $#!t tons of time and makes us look pretty cool

items.name: Regus
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A company that offers flexible and convenient workspace solutions for businesses of all sizes.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Regus
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. We use to use Regus as a virtual office during the pandemic to gather mail
  2. It's convenient, cost-effective, and has top notch addresses to make your business more legit

items.name: Shopify
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: An e-commerce platform that enables businesses of all sizes to create and manage their own online stores, allowing them to sell their products and services to a global audience.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Shopify
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2: 1. We use it to host our ecommerce storefront for the Hey Rebekah newsletter referral program

items.name: Printful
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A print-on-demand and fulfillment service that helps businesses to create and sell custom products without the need for upfront inventory or production costs.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Printful
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2: 1. We use it to produce swag on demand for our newsletter referral program

items.name: Pipedream
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A platform for building and deploying serverless workflows and integrations, enabling developers to automate and scale their processes with ease.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Pipedream
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
Ooh, this is another one we're excited about!

  1. Pipedream lets us connect any app with an API with little to no-code, like low-code
  2. It's like Zapier but more robust
  3. We use it to connect Webflow to Segment, Beehiiv to Close and a whole bunch of other systems, it's pretty awesome

items.name: NameCheap
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A company that offers affordable and reliable domain registration and hosting services, helping businesses and individuals to establish a professional online presence at an affordable price.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of NameCheap
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. Namecheap is our primary domain registrar
  2. We use it for private domain registrations
  3. We usually point the domain's NS to Cloudflare

items.name: Mixpanel
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A powerful analytics platform that helps businesses to understand and improve the user experience of their products, allowing them to make data-driven decisions and drive growth.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Mixpanel
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. We use Mixpanel to measure specific product/UX goals on our website(s)
  2. We use Mixpanel to visualize progress vs. goals for our UX objectives
  3. We use it to improve the UX and conversion flow of our digital assets/channels, the ones built by us

items.name: Miro
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A collaborative whiteboard platform that enables teams to brainstorm, plan, and design together in real-time, helping them to work more effectively and efficiently.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Miro
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. We use Miro to create fancy looking diagrams and illustrations for client work
  2. We use it for strategic documents for internal work
  3. We use it to organize processes and workflows visually

items.name: Libsyn
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A platform for publishing and distributing podcasts, helping content creators to share their audio with a global audience and grow their reach and influence.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Libsyn
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. We use Libsyn to store, manage, distribute legacy podcasts
  2. We'll probably use it for future podcasts too

items.name: Kinsta
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A hosting provider that offers high-performance, scalable, and secure solutions for businesses of all sizes, helping them to grow and succeed online.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Kinsta
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2: 1. We use Kinsta to host legacy client websites

items.name: Keeper Security
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A company that offers a range of tools and services for protecting online accounts and data, helping individuals and businesses to stay safe and secure in the digital world.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Keeper for Business
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. We use it to administer access to our company's systems
  2. To manage security policies and secure passwords for all our systems
  3. To make it easier to remember a million different passwords
  4. To monitor breaches and keep security jacked

items.name: Hotjar
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A platform for analyzing and improving website user experience, providing businesses with the insights they need to optimize their online presence and drive growth.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Hotjar
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. To improve our UX by visualizing traffic on our website
  2. To improve conversion paths with heat maps by identifying bottlenecks
  3. To validate UX assumptions

items.name: Iconscout
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A platform for finding and using high-quality icons and graphics, helping designers to easily incorporate visual elements into their projects and bring their ideas to life.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Iconscout
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. To make our website look prettier with consistent professional illustrations/icons
  2. To add motion and delight to our website with Lottie animations

items.name: Google Workspace
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A suite of productivity tools that includes Gmail, Drive, Docs, Sheets, and more, helping teams to communicate, collaborate, and get work done more efficiently.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Google Workspace
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. We use Google Workspace for our email
  2. We use it for documents, drives, sheets and stuff too
  3. We don't use the intranet enough, but did with a client previously

items.name: Heap
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A tool for automating the collection, analysis, and visualization of user data, helping companies to understand and improve the user experience of their products and services.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Heap

items.name: Harvest
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A platform for tracking and managing time and expenses, enabling businesses to accurately bill their clients and optimize their workflow.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Harvest
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. When and if we have client engagements, we use Harvest for time-tracking, reporting, and billing
  2. We use it for client approval of estimates, timesheets, invoicing, payments
  3. All of our client engagements are performed on time and materials basis so Harvest works great for us

items.name: Google Cloud Platform
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A comprehensive suite of cloud computing services that enables businesses to build, deploy, and scale applications and websites in a secure and reliable environment.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Google Cloud Platform
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. We use GCP for our infrastructure-as-a-service for apps
  2. We stuck with GCP over AWS because it's more integrated to our existing Google products and suits our scope

items.short-description: Seamless fraud and bot detection service.
items.name: Google Captcha
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A security measure designed to protect websites from bots and automated abuse, helping to ensure that only human users can access and interact with online content.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Google Captcha
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. Ugh, who doesn't love Google Captcha? We use it to keep our forms more secure
  2. To minimize bot-spam
  3. It's one of those necessary evils because we haven't spent time reviewing Cloudflare Turnstile yet

items.name: Github
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A platform for collaborating on software projects and tracking code changes, enabling developers to work together and build better software more efficiently.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Github
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. We use it for version/source control of our code
  2. We use it to maintain dependencies up-to-date in our code
  3. We use it to centralize development tasks and manage multi-threaded code
  4. We use it to deploy production code to various destinations

items.name: Google Big Query
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A powerful cloud-based data warehousing solution that allows companies to quickly and easily analyze large datasets and make informed decisions based on the insights they uncover.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Google Big Query
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. We use Google BigQuery to consolidate all of the data from our sources/destinations to one place
  2. It's our primary data-warehouse that's multi-cloud and infinitely scalable
  3. The data-warehouse enables us to have an industry leading data-pipeline to achieve one of our OKRs of making Buzzfeed look like the WSJ

items.name: FlutterFlow
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: Create beautiful UI, generate clean code, and deploy to the app stores or web in one click. Fully extensible with custom code.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of FlutterFlow
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
This is another one of our favorite new apps.

  1. We use it to experiment with mobile UI/UX patterns
  2. We use it to whip up mobile prototypes in a teeny fraction of the time it would normally take
  3. We use it to create dazzling mobile experiences for internal tools
  4. We will be using it to extend the Hey Rebekah community to native mobile apps in the future

items.name: Dropbox
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A platform for storing, organizing, and sharing files in the cloud, enabling individuals and teams to access their documents from anywhere and collaborate more seamlessly.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Dropbox
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. We use it like Finder in the cloud to store all company documents we create on our computer.
  2. We use it for redundancy and security
  3. We use it to get version history in some cases on documents we create offline
  4. We use it to share documents outside of the organization
  5. It's like our digital filing cabinet.

items.short-description: Web and mobile app infrastructure as a service, by Google.
items.name: Google Firebase
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: Google Firebase, a platform for building, scaling, and managing mobile and web applications, providing developers with a range of tools and services to build and grow their projects with ease.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Google Firebase
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. We use it to run the backends for our internal mobile apps
  2. We use it for authentication
  3. We use it as a No SQL database for storage
  4. We use it for Cloud Functions too

items.name: Finsweet
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A company that helps businesses to create and implement effective digital marketing strategies, leveraging the latest tools and techniques to reach their target audience and achieve their goals.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Finsweet
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. We use Finsweet Attributes and Finsweet Pro to improve the experience of our Webflow sites
  2. We use it to sort/filter CMS items on Webflow
  3. We use it for social sharing on our Blog
  4. We use Finsweet's Client-First framework and template as an opinionated development standard for multi-threaded development of our websites

items.name: Equals.app
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: The only spreadsheet with built-in connections to any database, versioning, and collaboration, a tool for helping teams manage and analyze data in a powerful and efficient manner.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Equals.app
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
OMG, this is one of our favorite new apps.

  1. We use it to connect live-data to a sheet and conduct analysis
  2. We conduct audience funnel analysis from our data-pipeline
  3. We conduct topic funnel analysis from our data-pipeline
  4. We conduct financial/performance analysis from our data-pipeline

items.name: Droplr
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A service for sharing files and screenshots quickly and easily, allowing users to share their work with others in a simple and convenient way.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Droplr
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. We use it as a quick way to take screenshots
  2. We use it to share short screen recordings
  3. We use it to markup screenshots
  4. We use it to shorten URLs with our personalized short URL

items.name: Cloudflare
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A service that offers website performance optimization, security, and reliability, helping businesses to ensure that their online presence is always running smoothly.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Cloudflare
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. Speed up DNS with 1.1.1.1
  2. DNS management for our domains
  3. Web security and performance optimization for our sites
  4. Media storage with Cloudflare Stream

items.name: Coolors
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A tool for generating and discovering color palettes, helping designers to find inspiration and create cohesive designs with ease.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Coolors
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. To explore color palettes for any initiative
  2. To define color paletters
  3. To share and organize color spaces
  4. To manage our brands' colors and color spaces

items.name: Close
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A sales CRM platform that helps businesses streamline their sales processes and close more deals with ease.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Close
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. Brand partnership outreach
  2. Brand sponsorship outreach
  3. Track all brand partnership opportunities - brands that can help our audience
  4. Track all brand sponsorship opportunities - brands that advertise with us to our audience
  5. Manage our pipelines for partnerships/sponsorships
  6. Revenue forecasting
  7. Keeping track of all communications with partners/sponsors in one place

items.name: Brand24
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A platform for monitoring and analyzing online mentions of a brand, allowing companies to stay attuned to the pulse of their reputation and make informed decisions about their online presence.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Brand24
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. Keep tabs on mentions of Rebekah Radice and Hey Rebekah
  2. To monitor sentiment
  3. To engage with followers on social channels
  4. Better understand our followers
  5. Monitor and measure our brand performance on social

items.name: Calendly
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A tool for simplifying the process of scheduling appointments and meetings, saving time and effort for both individuals and teams.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Calendly
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. Schedule meetings asynchronously with people outside the company
  2. Optimize our meeting schedules to early am
  3. Look fancy by having an automated virtual assistant who manages our time

items.name: Beehiiv
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A platform for creating and sending beautiful email newsletters.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Beehiiv
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. Storing the Hey Rebekah newsletter subscribers
  2. Drafting the Hey Rebekah newsletter emails/posts
  3. Scheduling and distribution of the posts
  4. Administering the Hey Rebekah referral program
  5. Email newsletter performance metrics

items.name: Blinkist
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A service that offers condensed summaries of non-fiction books, providing busy individuals with the opportunity to stay informed and educated on a variety of subjects.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Blinkist
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. To get a concise summary of the key takeaways from a book
  2. To get up to speed on certain topics we need a refresher on
  3. To save time by focusing on the TL;DR version
  4. To stay up-to-date and provoke thought

items.name: AgoraPulse
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A means by which companies can streamline their social media management and save valuable time in the fast-paced world of the internet.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of AgoraPulse
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. Social media planning
  2. Social media scheduling
  3. Social media listening
  4. Social media publishing

items.name: Amplitude
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A powerful analytics platform for companies seeking to understand and improve their digital products.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Amplitude
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. UX analytics for our website
  2. Monitoring specific conversion flow metrics on our website
  3. Misc. product analytics

items.name: Adobe Creative Cloud
items.tool-description-in-jtbd-format: A tool for the modern artist to wield in the digital age.
items.tool-logo-alt-text: A black and white logo of Adobe Creative Cloud
items.how-hey-rebekah-uses-it-2:
1. Advanced graphics and illustrations
  2. Creating publications
  3. Motion graphics
  4. Video editing
